intro: Bupleurum junceum var. multiflorum, commonly known as the many-flowered bupleurum, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in summer, adding ornamental value to its habitat. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or alpine environments. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been used in traditional herbal medicine for various ailments.
